unnormalised: So, I'm trying to figure out this whole health insurance thing in India, and honestly, it feels like cracking the IIT JEE all over again! My dad keeps saying, "Beta, just give them your UHID number!" But seriously, what even *is* a UHID? Mine’s like a secret code - 1234-ABCD-5678 - and every hospital seems to want a different set of numbers!
normalised: So, I'm trying to figure out this whole health insurance thing in India, and honestly, it feels like cracking the I-I-T J-E-E all over again! My dad keeps saying, "Beta, just give them your U-H-I-D number!" But seriously, what even *is* a U-H-I-D? Mine's like a secret code - one two three four hyphen A-B-C-D hyphen five six seven eight - and every hospital seems to want a different set of numbers!

unnormalised: Then there's the whole TPA ID thing. My insurance company, "HealthyBima", gave me this card with a TPA ID that looks suspiciously like a serial number from a vintage Nokia phone: TPA-HB-2024-XYZ. And the hospital receptionists just stare at me blankly. Do they even *know* what a TPA is? I swear, trying to explain it feels like teaching my grandma to use TikTok.
normalised: Then there's the whole T-P-A I-D thing. My insurance company, "HealthyBima", gave me this card with a T-P-A I-D that looks suspiciously like a serial number from a vintage Nokia phone: T-P-A hyphen H-B hyphen two thousand and twenty four hyphen X-Y-Z. And the hospital receptionists just stare at me blankly. Do they even *know* what a T-P-A is? I swear, trying to explain it feels like teaching my grandma to use TikTok.

unnormalised: And don't even get me started on the insurance policy number! It’s longer than a Bollywood movie title, something like HLB/DEL/2023/00789/01, and I always end up misreading at least one digit when I’m filling out the forms. It's like they *want* us to have a medical emergency just trying to find our insurance info!
normalised: And don't even get me started on the insurance policy number! unnormalised: So, yeah, health identifiers are less "identifiers" and more like "obstacles" in my humble opinion. Maybe they should just give us all a simple, memorable code, like "PriyaSharmaRocks" or something. It would certainly make things less…entertainingly frustrating.
